application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Addison, TX, USA; Ashburn, VA, USA
description:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.

As a Network Engineer, you will help us build, plan, and design Google's large production global network. You will develop optical network planning best practices, processes, and tooling. You will also plan and design Google's optical network capacity and routing, using and developing tools and processes to support capacity planning, design, and delivery.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 2 years of experience implementing and/or supporting area networks.
  • Experience programming in C++, C, or Python.
  • Experience with full suite of TCP/IP-based protocols and routing and network management protocols.
  • Experience with DWDM, layer 2/3 technologies, the operation of IP networks, and test equipment such as OTDR, OSA, BERT.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 5 years of recent coding experience in two or more of the following languages: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective-C, Python, JavaScript, PHP, Ruby, or Go.
  • Knowledge of the fundamentals of optical networking, including Fiber optics and Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing (DWDM) technologies.
responsibilities:
• Perform data management, handling, and analyses.
  • Facilitate process analysis and development.
  • Work on transport (optical networks) engineering.
  • Provide new product introduction (NPI) support.
  • Participate in light software development in Angular, Python, and Go.
title: Network Engineer, Tools
